action_title: Reduce inter-specific competition for nest sites of songbirds by removing competitor species
key_messages:
Key Messages:

Two studies from Australia found increases in bird populations and species richness after the control of noisy miners Manorina melanocephala â€“ a native but hyper-competitive species.
A controlled study from Italy found that blue tits Parus caeruleus nested in more nest boxes when hazel dormice Muscardinus avellanarius were excluded from nest boxes over winter.
